name: index
description: The SOTA Open-Source Browser Agent for autonomously performing complex tasks on the web
readme_summary: Index is an open-source browser agent that autonomously executes complex web-based tasks. It leverages reasoning LLMs with vision capabilities and offers various interfaces, including a CLI, serverless API, and Chat UI. The agent also provides advanced browser observability through integration with the Laminar platform.
key_features: Powered by reasoning LLMs with vision capabilities (Gemini 2.5 Pro, Claude 3.7 Sonnet, OpenAI o4-mini, Gemini 2.5 Flash)
Advanced browser agent observability powered by Laminar
primary_use_case: Autonomously performing complex tasks on the web
cover_image_prompt: A skilled navigator at the helm of a web browser, charting a course through a sea of information, transforming complex tasks into streamlined actions. The navigator uses advanced tools to understand and interact with the web, creating spreadsheets and summarizing data with ease. Digital particles flow from the browser, forming clear, concise reports and organized data visualizations. Small UI elements display the agent's reasoning process and actions. The scene is set in a futuristic control room with soft, ambient lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: tablepilot
description: A powerful CLI/API/WebUI tool that lets you create tables using natural language and effortlessly generate or autofill content with AI.

name: rust-stakeholder
description: Generate impressive-looking terminal output to look busy when stakeholders walk by

name: bashly
description: Bash command line framework and CLI generator

name: supercronic
readme_summary: Supercronic is a crontab-compatible job runner specifically designed for container environments. It addresses the shortcomings of traditional cron implementations in containers by preserving environment variables, logging to stdout/stderr, handling signals gracefully, and supporting second-resolution schedules. It's ideal for anyone needing reliable cron job scheduling within containers.
key_features: Environment variables are available in jobs
Job output is logged to stdout/stderr
Graceful shutdown on SIGTERM, SIGINT, and SIGQUIT
SIGUSR2 triggers graceful shutdown and reloads crontab
primary_use_case: Running cron jobs in containerized environments, particularly where standard cron implementations are ill-suited.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent clockwork robot meticulously tending a garden of container plants, each representing a scheduled task. The robot carefully waters the plants with environment variables, ensuring their healthy growth. A digital display on the robot's chest shows a crontab schedule, and its arms gracefully handle signals like SIGTERM and SIGUSR2. The garden is bathed in the soft glow of stdout/stderr logs, illuminating the return codes and schedules. The scene is set in a futuristic greenhouse with a clean, focused composition and a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: codimd
description: CodiMD - Realtime collaborative markdown notes on all platforms.
readme_summary: CodiMD is an open-source, self-hostable, real-time collaborative markdown editor. It allows multiple users to simultaneously edit and view markdown documents, making it ideal for team collaboration, documentation, and note-taking. CodiMD is based on HackMD and offers extensive customization options.
key_features: Supports various configuration options (networking, security, authentication, etc.)
primary_use_case: Real-time collaborative markdown note-taking and documentation for teams and communities.
cover_image_prompt: A group of architects collaboratively designing a building blueprint in real-time on a shared holographic table. Each architect contributes to the design using digital pens, with changes instantly visible to everyone. The blueprint transforms from a simple sketch into a detailed architectural plan with glowing lines and annotations. Small screens around the table display markdown code snippets and version history. The scene is set in a bright, modern studio with a collaborative atmosphere. The image should be in a clean, flat design style with clear iconography and a vibrant color scheme.

name: flatnotes
description: A self-hosted, database-less note taking web app that utilises a flat folder of markdown files for storage.
readme_summary: Flatnotes is a self-hosted, database-less note-taking web application that stores notes as markdown files. It offers features like advanced search, tagging, wikilinks, and multiple authentication options, aiming for a distraction-free note-taking experience with a clean and simple interface.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a tidy desk with a single, open notebook at its center. A focused writer sits at the desk, effortlessly composing notes directly into the notebook. Around the desk, loose papers representing scattered thoughts are neatly organized and filed into the notebook. A soft glow emanates from the notebook, highlighting the organized content. Subtle UI elements float around the notebook, suggesting search and tagging functionalities. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light, creating a sense of calm productivity. The image should be in a clean, flat design style with clear iconography and a pastel color scheme.
